body: Closing, as old version bug. PR is welcome if anyone is interested before we remove 5.x supports.

> > I think it's hard to get url from HessianSkeleton. In HessianSkeleton i only can get the api class. If i want get url, i should send it in the stream from client side, and get it from the inputstream in server side. that's not an easy thing.
> 
> This is server side instrumentation, right? Why send from client side? That header should not be added.

Yes, HessianSkeleton is an instrumentation. in HessianSkeleton it only read or write data from stream. 
Header value is in HessianServlet or HessianServiceExporter, the are the library out of hessian.

> Yes, HessianSkeleton is an instrumentation. in HessianSkeleton it only read or write data from stream.
Header value is in HessianServlet or HessianServiceExporter, the are the library out of hessian.

Are you saying the data in HessianSkeleton is only binary and not encoded yet? If so, don't instrument there.

pr has  been merged, close this

@yijiuping I also encounter the same problem, through your contribution we can accurately know that table are endpoint Name is too long, but we can not limit endpoint Name to the application side, do you have any good suggestions?
Basically and easiest way, you could use agent core to restrict the length when creating span, if you like.

> @zhaoyuguang Could you help on this?

I am very interested in kafka, but I will try to finish it at 6.4.0, if other people are interested, welcome.

In our case, we are using spring mvc for RESTful interface provider, and
some of the controller methods write many input arguments, and the default
tomcat plugin will using the spring mvc controller method signature for
span name. A simple way to ignore this issue is remove the tomcat plugin
from agent, by this change it can also  ignore many inventory being
created.

wow， i will verify today

> 您好，这里报的错是网关的错，怎么跟es有关呢，还有请问我的es应该是正常启动了的啊，同样这个错误

English only.
my ES started normally, but Zull still refused to connect

> my ES started normally, but Zull still refused to connect

Check OAP log. The Zuul error means, OAP server is not available, unless you set IP/port wrongly.

Are you switching to a new ElasticSearch cluster when you upgrade to 6.2 from 6.1? It is not compatible. If this goes w/ payload(service number), have you read this? https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/FAQ/ES-Server-FAQ.md

> In today's ES storage, the ES Hour/Minute level metrics are deleted through day level TTL.

I know that, and the `EsHourTTLCalculator` truncates the date format to `yyyyMMdd`. But the calculation is wrong IMHO:

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/5036e8334301322d49973005cd98513c17b0f28f/oap-server/server-storage-plugin/storage-elasticsearch-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/storage/plugin/elasticsearch/ttl/EsHourTTLCalculator.java#L30

For example, `timeBefore` 20190728 18:00:00 with `DataTTLConfig#hourMetricsDataTTL=3` should return `20190728`, but it actually returns `20190725`, which I think will keep more old data than expected

No, the design is `20190725`. The unit is **DAY** when we are talking about ES storage TTL. Read this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/ttl.md#elasticsearch-6-storage-ttl
we use 6.2 first ,alfter bulk error,  we clear all ElasticSearch's data and change to 6.1
Have you set the batch configurations to ES? I think that should help.

oap  set concurrentRequests:6 ,   6.1 and 6.2 's configuration is same 
 i want to kown  if we update to 6.2 form 6.1 ,do we need to update agent version
Update, no, I think. But reboot is required, due to the es storage erased.
reboot  oap  or our service
You upgrade OAP, so reboot yes. Also services w/ agent need to reboot.
thanks
Any update? @candyleer
wait a moment ,I am verifying now
verified .works well
Thanks. Please approve and merge.

For plugins, we are open to accept, take a ref to plugin development document.

For DB, whole access time is logically, it is different. I think more reasonable metrics are transaction time metrics, but it is not easy.

Speaking external http, it is shows in topo, just don't show endpoint level. It looks like a little too much payload to analysis and storage. Because at the agent perspective, there is not real external call.

OpenTelemetry, I would not be too optimistic. I am a member OpenTracing Specification Council for long time, that thing is not that good as it described. Due to we have auto instrumentation plugin, OpenTelemetry  and OpenTracing things should be treated as an manual instrument API in business codes only, but not in framework level. We have OpenTracing toolkit for that purpose. You could use it today.
Plugin should be easy to start.

> For plugins, we are open to accept, take a ref to plugin development document.
> 
> For DB, whole access time is logically, it is different. I think more reasonable metrics are transaction time metrics, but it is not easy.
> 
> Speaking external http, it is shows in topo, just don't show endpoint level. It looks like a little too much payload to analysis and storage. Because at the agent perspective, there is not real external call.
> 
> OpenTelemetry, I would not be too optimistic. I am a member OpenTracing Specification Council for long time, that thing is not that good as it described. Due to we have auto instrumentation plugin, OpenTelemetry and OpenTracing things should be treated as an manual instrument API in business codes only, but not in framework level. We have OpenTracing toolkit for that purpose. You could use it today.

can we have opencensus toolkit as well?
or it is to big assignment

i will look on the documentation and will see how i can build plugins
thanks!

Toolkit is also open to contribute, but build one takes time. Today, core committers at least are not working on this. I just even added bootstrap auto instrumentation. Most users, if they want codes level instrumentation, they choose skywalking annotation to target method.
Hi @wu-sheng , most of the review comments (if not all) are addressed, really appreciate the professional opinions. Hope I fully got your points, thanks again
That is as it said... ElasticSearch doesn't response.
We also have a machine connected to this es, which can work normally all the time
Then, you should check the version, auth. or anything affecting the es connectable. There is nothing special there.
Are you saying that we failed to connect with es successfully?
From the log, yes. This is just a very simple query to es, but can't access.
Version, address, username and password are all correct. What else might be the reason?

I am not sure then. SkyWalking is just supporting easy auth. Please check whether it fits your server side. Have you read this? https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/backend-storage.md#about-authentication
I have the same issues,using K8S

I changed the log level to debug and found the logs. I guess it's the reason for the cache (mesh-buffer, trace-buffer).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24448049/62020598-37ef1f80-b1f6-11e9-91be-e4483978de66.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24448049/62020539-f6f70b00-b1f5-11e9-94aa-b392318c1fb0.png)
There is nothing k8s or VM. That is caused by your storage deleted. So reboot the agent and delete trace-cache folder. There is pointless to say having an issue, but not follow the suggestions.

`Unable to open socket file: target process not responding` this shows your file handler number has been limited. This is a Linux OS error.

Standalone mode depends on how powerful your VM is, how many CPU and memory for OAP and ES?
